RECORD.TEXT: 026738007 15319689 3/25/1998 12:00:00 AM Signed DIS Admission Date : Signed Discharge Date : 04/08/1998 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Right lung choriocarcinoma . OTHER DIAGNOSIS : HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient was in her usual state of health , carrying the diagnosis of right lung chorio carcinoma , when she began to develop dyspnea and on 03/24/98 an echocardiogram revealed a pericardial effusion and possible tamponade clinically . The patient was first diagnosed in 10/97 , when she presented with the symptoms of menorrhagia . She had elevated beta HCG levels , no tubal pregnancy was suspected . Aright oophorectomy was performed . On November 26 , a chest CT revealed multiple bilateral cysts and bilateral ill-defined nodules , a right upper lobe mass , and extensive lymphadenopathy in the peritracheal region . There was also some distal tracheal compression . She received XRT and chemotherapy with carboplatin and Taxol . A head CT was also performed , revealing frontal lobe lesions consistent with cranial metastasis . VIP therapy and cranial XRT were performed . On 03/24/98 , an echocardiogram revealed a pericardial effusion . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : 1. Schizoaffective disorder . 2. Status post right oophorectomy . 3. History of seizure disorder . ALLERGIES : 2. Macrodantin causes joint stiffness . MEDICATIONS : 1. Clonidine . 2. Trazodone 100 mg p.o. q h.s. 4. Klonopin 1 mg p.o. t.i.d. The mother died of asthma . SOCIAL HISTORY : The patient lives in Jer by herself . However , her boyfriend lives next-door . HABITS : She reports having just quit prior to admission . She denies any alcohol or street drug use . VITAL SIGNS : Temperature 97.5 , heart rate 90 , blood pressure 104/80 , respiratory rate 18 . Oxygen saturation is 94% on room air . HEENT : Pupils equal , round and reactive to light . Normal mucosa . Supple . No crackles . CARDIOVASCULAR : Regular rate and rhythm , no murmurs . ABDOMEN : Positive bowel sounds , soft . DIAGNOSTIC STUDIES : Metabolic 20 panel was unremarkable . CBC was unremarkable . HOSPITAL COURSE : During that time , on 03/26/98 a pericardial centesis was performed and 550 cc of bloody fluid were removed . Amediastinoscopy was also performed at that time . However , on 03/27/98 she had increasing dyspnea , pleuritic chest pain , and mild hemoptysis . Apulmonary embolus was suspected . However , a VQ scan was performed , which revealed intermediate probability . The defects were in the right upper lobe and this was felt to be unlikely to be consistent with a pulmonary embolus . On 03/28/98 another pericardial centesis was performed , withdrawing 350-400 cc fluid . On 03/29/98 apericardial window was performed , revealing a non malignant effusion . Velban was continued for two days , while Cisplatin was continued for five days , until 04/07/98 . The patient tolerated chemotherapy very well , with no side effects . DISPOSITION : Follow-up will be with Dr. Shock , her primary hematologist-oncologist , on 04/13/98 . DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : 1. Tegretol 200 mg p.o. t.i.d. 2. Klonopin 1 mg p.o. b.i.d. 4. Nicoderm 21 mg q d. topical . 5. Zofran 24 mg p.o. q d. x 3 days . 6. Mellaril 100 mg p.o. q h.s. 7. Trazodone 150 mg p.o. q h.s. 8. Compazine 10 mg p.o. q 6 h. p.r.n. for nausea . 9. G-CSF 300 microgram subq. q d. Attending : Batch : 25796 Index No. LWART6 IO D : 04/08/98 T : 04/09/98 CC : 1. DR. SHOCK
